title: Jeremiah Chapter 37 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Jeremiah chapter 37 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Jeremiah Chapter 37 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Jeremiah Chapter 37.

questions.question: Who reigned as king instead of Coniah, the son of Jehoiakim, in the land of Judah?
questions.correctAnswer: Zedekiah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:1 states that king Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah.

questions.question: What did neither Zedekiah, his servants, nor the people do according to the LORD's words?
options: Hearken unto the words of the LORD
Build a wall around the city
questions.correctAnswer: Hearken unto the words of the LORD
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:2 says neither Zedekiah, nor his servants, nor the people hearkened unto the words of the LORD.

questions.question: Who did King Zedekiah send to the prophet Jeremiah to pray for them?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehucal and Zephaniah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:3 mentions King Zedekiah sent Jehucal and Zephaniah to Jeremiah.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah was put into prison immediately when King Zedekiah sent men to him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:4 says Jeremiah came in and went out among the people because they had not put him into prison.

questions.question: What caused the Chaldeans to depart from Jerusalem temporarily?
options: The coming of Pharaoh's army out of Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: The coming of Pharaoh's army out of Egypt
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:5 states the Chaldeans departed when they heard tidings of Pharaoh's army coming out of Egypt.

questions.question: According to the LORD's message, what would Pharaoh's army do after coming to help?
questions.correctAnswer: Return to Egypt
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:7 says Pharaoh's army which came to help would return to Egypt.

questions.question: What did the LORD say the Chaldeans would do after Pharaoh's army returned to Egypt?
options: Come again, fight, take, and burn the city
questions.correctAnswer: Come again, fight, take, and burn the city
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:8 reveals that the Chaldeans would come again to fight and burn the city.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah was accused of falling away to the Chaldeans by a captain named Irijah.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:13 states that Irijah, a captain of the ward, accused Jeremiah of falling away to the Chaldeans.

questions.question: Where was Jeremiah put after the princes were wroth with him and smote him?
options: In the house of Jonathan the scribe
questions.correctAnswer: In the house of Jonathan the scribe
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:15 says the princes put Jeremiah in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe.

questions.question: What did King Zedekiah ask Jeremiah secretly in his house?
options: Is there any word from the LORD?
Should we rebuild the city walls?
Is the army ready for battle?
questions.correctAnswer: Is there any word from the LORD?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:17 records King Zedekiah asking Jeremiah if there was any word from the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah told King Zedekiah he would be delivered from the king of Babylon.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:17 states Jeremiah said Zedekiah would be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, not delivered from him.

questions.question: What did Jeremiah ask the king to do regarding his imprisonment?
options: Not to return him to the house of Jonathan the scribe
questions.correctAnswer: Not to return him to the house of Jonathan the scribe
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:20 contains Jeremiah's plea not to be returned to the house of Jonathan the scribe lest he die there.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison and was given daily a piece of ______ out of the bakers' street.
questions.correctAnswer: bread
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:21 says Jeremiah was given daily a piece of bread out of the bakers' street.

questions.question: Who was the captain of the ward that took Jeremiah at the gate of Benjamin?
questions.correctAnswer: Irijah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:13 identifies Irijah as the captain of the ward who took Jeremiah.

questions.question: When Jeremiah was imprisoned, in what type of place did he remain for many days?
questions.correctAnswer: Dungeon and cabins
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:16 states Jeremiah remained many days in the dungeon and cabins.

medium.title: Jeremiah Chapter 37 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Jeremiah Chapter 37 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Jeremiah 37 teach us about the importance of obedience to God's word even in difficult times?
options: King Zedekiah and the people did not listen to the LORD's words through Jeremiah
The people immediately obeyed Jeremiah's prophecies
Jeremiah refused to speak God's word due to fear
The king fully trusted the LORD without doubt
questions.correctAnswer: King Zedekiah and the people did not listen to the LORD's words through Jeremiah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:2 shows neither the king nor the people hearkened to the LORD's words spoken through the prophet Jeremiah, highlighting the challenge of obedience in trials. This teaches the importance of trusting and obeying God even when circumstances are difficult (Jeremiah 37:2, 37:7, 37:9).

questions.question: A believer is seeking guidance on prayer during crises. Based on Jeremiah 37, what biblical truth would you share about prayer?
options: Even kings can and should pray to God for help
Prayer is unnecessary when armies fight
Only priests have access to pray for the nation
questions.correctAnswer: Even kings can and should pray to God for help
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:3 shows King Zedekiah sending messengers to Jeremiah to pray to the LORD on their behalf, emphasizing the role of prayer in seeking God's guidance and help during trials (Jeremiah 37:3, 37:17).

questions.question: What does Jeremiah 37 teach about maintaining integrity and honesty in the face of false accusations?
options: Jeremiah insisted he was not defecting to the Chaldeans despite being accused
Jeremiah admitted to wrongdoing to avoid punishment
Jeremiah fled to avoid the accusations
questions.correctAnswer: Jeremiah insisted he was not defecting to the Chaldeans despite being accused
questions.explanation: In Jeremiah 37:13-14, Jeremiah truthfully denies the false accusation of defecting to the enemy, demonstrating integrity and courage in trials. This teaches believers to uphold honesty even when wrongly accused (Jeremiah 37:13-14, 37:18).

questions.question: How does Jeremiah 37 emphasize humility and dependence on God's sovereign will?
options: Jeremiah acknowledges God's control over the fate of Jerusalem despite human plans
Jeremiah declares the city will never fall
The king's military plans override God's word
Pharaoh's army is the ultimate savior
questions.correctAnswer: Jeremiah acknowledges God's control over the fate of Jerusalem despite human plans
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:7-10 teaches that despite human alliances and efforts, God controls the city's destiny, urging humility and trust in His sovereign will (Jeremiah 37:7-10, 37:9).

questions.question: What biblical principle about perseverance through trials can we learn from Jeremiah's imprisonment in chapter 37?
options: Jeremiah remained faithful and continued to speak God's word despite suffering
Jeremiah gave up his prophetic mission while imprisoned
Jeremiah escaped prison to avoid hardship
Jeremiah blamed God for his imprisonment
questions.correctAnswer: Jeremiah remained faithful and continued to speak God's word despite suffering
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:15-17 shows Jeremiah being imprisoned yet still communicating God's messages to the king, exemplifying perseverance and faithfulness amid trials (Jeremiah 37:15-17, 37:20).

questions.question: In what way does Jeremiah 37 teach us about trusting God's word over false hope?
options: Jeremiah warns against deceiving themselves that the Chaldeans will depart
Jeremiah encourages relying on Pharaoh's army alone
Jeremiah assures immediate peace without conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Jeremiah warns against deceiving themselves that the Chaldeans will depart
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:9-10 warns the people not to deceive themselves about false security, teaching trust in God's truthful warnings rather than empty hope (Jeremiah 37:9-10, 37:8).

questions.question: How does Jeremiah 37 illustrate the role of leaders in seeking God’s guidance for their people?
options: King Zedekiah sent men to Jeremiah to inquire and pray to the LORD
The king ignored the prophet's counsel completely
The leaders trusted their own wisdom without God
The priests refused to seek God’s guidance
questions.correctAnswer: King Zedekiah sent men to Jeremiah to inquire and pray to the LORD
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:3 shows the king actively seeking God's counsel through Jeremiah, teaching leaders to humbly seek divine guidance for their responsibilities (Jeremiah 37:3, 37:17).

questions.question: What does Jeremiah 37 teach about God's faithfulness even when people disobey Him?
options: God continues to send prophets and warnings despite disobedience
God immediately destroys those who disobey
God abandons His people without warning
God ignores the cries of disobedient people
questions.correctAnswer: God continues to send prophets and warnings despite disobedience
questions.explanation: The chapter shows Jeremiah faithfully delivering God's messages even when ignored or imprisoned, demonstrating God's persistent faithfulness and desire for repentance (Jeremiah 37:2, 37:6-7, 37:15).

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah was imprisoned in the house of Jonathan the scribe because the princes were angry with him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:15 states the princes were wroth with Jeremiah, smote him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe, showing opposition to faithful witnesses.

questions.question: True or False: Pharaoh's army successfully saved Jerusalem from the Chaldeans according to Jeremiah 37.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:7-10 reveals that Pharaoh's army would return to Egypt and the Chaldeans would come again to fight and burn Jerusalem, indicating no lasting salvation from Egypt (Jeremiah 37:5-8).

questions.question: Jeremiah was taken to prison because he was accused of ________ to the Chaldeans.
questions.correctAnswer: falling away
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:13 says a captain accused Jeremiah of falling away (defecting) to the Chaldeans, leading to his imprisonment, illustrating challenges believers face when falsely accused.

questions.question: What biblical virtue is demonstrated by King Zedekiah secretly asking Jeremiah for God's word despite others opposing him?
questions.correctAnswer: Humility and seeking God's counsel
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:17 shows the king secretly asking Jeremiah if there is any word from the LORD, demonstrating humility and dependence on God even when facing opposition (Jeremiah 37:17-18).

questions.question: How can Jeremiah’s example in chapter 37 encourage believers facing imprisonment or suffering for their faith?
options: To remain faithful and continue trusting God’s promises
To abandon their testimony to avoid hardship
To remain silent about God’s word
questions.correctAnswer: To remain faithful and continue trusting God’s promises
questions.explanation: Jeremiah remains faithful despite imprisonment and suffering (Jeremiah 37:15-17, 37:20), encouraging believers to persevere and trust God's promises amid hardship.

questions.question: What lesson about stewardship and provision can we learn from Jeremiah’s daily bread being given from the baker’s street while imprisoned?
options: God provides daily sustenance even in difficult times
We should hoard resources during trials
Bread was freely available to everyone
questions.correctAnswer: God provides daily sustenance even in difficult times
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:21 shows the king commanded daily bread be given to Jeremiah, illustrating God’s ongoing provision and the importance of trusting Him daily (Jeremiah 37:21).

questions.question: How does Jeremiah 37 guide believers in dealing with discouragement when leaders and people reject God's messenger?
options: Continue faithfully delivering God's word despite rejection
Speak only positive messages to please everyone
questions.correctAnswer: Continue faithfully delivering God's word despite rejection
questions.explanation: Jeremiah faces rejection and imprisonment but continues to proclaim God's message (Jeremiah 37:15-17, 37:20), teaching perseverance in ministry despite discouragement.

hard.title: Jeremiah Chapter 37 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Jeremiah Chapter 37.

questions.question: Who reigned as king instead of Coniah according to Jeremiah 37?
questions.correctAnswer: Zedekiah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:1 states that king Zedekiah, son of Josiah, reigned instead of Coniah.

questions.question: What was the people's response to the words of the LORD spoken by Jeremiah?
options: They sent a delegation to Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: They did not listen
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:2 clearly states that neither Zedekiah, his servants, nor the people hearkened unto the words of the LORD spoken by Jeremiah.

questions.question: Who did King Zedekiah send to Jeremiah to ask him to pray to the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehucal and Zephaniah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:3 identifies Jehucal son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah son of Maaseiah as the ones sent to Jeremiah.

questions.question: What was the reason the Chaldeans lifted the siege of Jerusalem temporarily?
options: Pharaoh's army came out of Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Pharaoh's army came out of Egypt
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:5 explains that when Pharaoh's army came out of Egypt, the Chaldeans departed from Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to God's word given to Jeremiah, what would happen to Pharaoh's army that came to help Judah?
questions.correctAnswer: They would return to Egypt
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:7 records God's message that Pharaoh's army would return to Egypt.

questions.question: What did the LORD say would happen to Jerusalem eventually despite Pharaoh's temporary aid?
options: The Chaldeans will return and burn it
questions.correctAnswer: The Chaldeans will return and burn it
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:8 foretells that the Chaldeans would come again, fight, take the city and burn it.

questions.question: What warning did the LORD give regarding false hope about the Chaldeans?
options: Do not deceive yourselves thinking they will depart
Trust in Pharaoh's army for protection
questions.correctAnswer: Do not deceive yourselves thinking they will depart
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:9 cautions against self-deception that the Chaldeans will surely depart, stating they will not.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Even if the entire Chaldean army was smitten, the survivors would still ________ the city with fire.
questions.correctAnswer: burn
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:10 explains that even if the army was wounded, they would rise up and burn the city.

questions.question: Who accused Jeremiah of defecting to the Chaldeans as he left Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Irijah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:13 tells that Irijah, a captain of the ward, accused Jeremiah of falling away to the Chaldeans.

questions.question: What was the punishment given to Jeremiah by the princes after the accusation?
questions.correctAnswer: Beaten and imprisoned
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:15 states that the princes were angry, smote Jeremiah, and put him in prison.

questions.question: Where was Jeremiah imprisoned as stated in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: House of Jonathan the scribe
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:15 specifies that Jeremiah was put in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe.

questions.question: What did King Zedekiah do after Jeremiah was imprisoned for many days?
questions.correctAnswer: He secretly questioned Jeremiah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:17 recounts that Zedekiah secretly asked Jeremiah if there was any word from the LORD.

questions.question: What was Jeremiah's prophecy to King Zedekiah during their secret meeting?
options: He would be delivered into the king of Babylon's hand
questions.correctAnswer: He would be delivered into the king of Babylon's hand
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:17 states Jeremiah told Zedekiah he would be delivered into the king of Babylon's hand.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah asked King Zedekiah why he was imprisoned despite having done no wrong.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:18 records Jeremiah questioning what offense he had given to be imprisoned.

questions.question: What does Jeremiah ask King Zedekiah to do to avoid his death in prison?
options: Accept his supplication and not send him back to Jonathan's house
questions.correctAnswer: Accept his supplication and not send him back to Jonathan's house
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:20 shows Jeremiah pleading to be spared from returning to the dungeon where he fears death.

theological.title: Jeremiah Chapter 37 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Jeremiah Chapter 37 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who reigned as king of Judah instead of Coniah according to Jeremiah 37?
questions.correctAnswer: Zedekiah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:1 states that king Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah, whom Nebuchadrezzar made king. This shows God's providence in the succession of kings (see also 2 Kings 24:17, 2 Chronicles 36:10, Ezekiel 12:13, Daniel 4:17).

questions.question: What was the response of King Zedekiah, his servants, and the people to the words of the LORD spoken through Jeremiah?
questions.correctAnswer: They did not listen
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:2 clearly states that neither Zedekiah, nor his servants, nor the people hearkened to the words of the LORD spoken through Jeremiah. This reflects human sinfulness and rejection of God's message (see also Isaiah 6:9-10, John 12:37-40, Romans 1:18-21, Hebrews 3:7-9).

questions.question: Whom did King Zedekiah send to Jeremiah to ask him to pray to the LORD for them?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehucal and Zephaniah
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:3 records that King Zedekiah sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest to Jeremiah to pray to the LORD for them. This shows reliance on the prophet as God's messenger (see also 1 Kings 22:8-28, 2 Chronicles 18:3-27, Acts 10:30, James 5:16).

questions.question: What action did Jeremiah take when Pharaoh's army came out of Egypt and the Chaldeans departed Jerusalem temporarily?
options: He went out among the people
questions.correctAnswer: He went out among the people
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:4 explains that Jeremiah came in and went out among the people because he was not put into prison at that time. This illustrates Jeremiah's active prophetic ministry despite political turmoil (see also Jeremiah 20:7-9, Ezekiel 2:1-7, Acts 4:19-20, 2 Timothy 4:2).

questions.question: What did the LORD say would happen to Pharaoh’s army that came to help Judah?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall return to Egypt
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:7 reports the LORD's word that Pharaoh's army would return to Egypt, indicating that human alliances apart from God's will are futile (see also Isaiah 31:1, Psalm 33:16-17, Jeremiah 2:18, Habakkuk 2:15).

questions.question: What final fate did the LORD declare for Jerusalem despite the temporary departure of the Chaldeans?
options: The Chaldeans will return and burn the city
The city will be saved permanently
The people will defeat the Chaldeans
The city will be delivered by the Egyptians
questions.correctAnswer: The Chaldeans will return and burn the city
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:8-10 states God’s judgment that the Chaldeans will return, fight, take the city, and burn it with fire, regardless of temporary military events. This underscores God's sovereign judgment and the certainty of His decrees (see also 2 Kings 25:9, Lamentations 2:3, Revelation 18:8, Hebrews 10:27).

questions.question: Why was Jeremiah accused and arrested by Irijah, the captain of the ward?
options: They accused him of defecting to the Chaldeans
He refused to pray for the king
questions.correctAnswer: They accused him of defecting to the Chaldeans
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:13 records that Irijah accused Jeremiah of falling away to the Chaldeans, showing the hostility prophets often faced when delivering unpopular messages (see also Jeremiah 26:8-11, 1 Kings 18:17-18, Matthew 10:24-25, 2 Timothy 3:12).

questions.question: Where was Jeremiah imprisoned by the princes after being beaten?
questions.correctAnswer: House of Jonathan the scribe
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:15 states that the princes put Jeremiah in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe, which had been made a prison. This reflects the opposition Jeremiah faced for speaking God’s truth (see also Jeremiah 20:2-3, Acts 16:23-24, 2 Corinthians 11:23-27, Hebrews 11:36-38).

questions.question: What did King Zedekiah ask Jeremiah secretly after having him brought out of prison?
options: Is there any word from the LORD?
Why do you prophesy against us?
questions.correctAnswer: Is there any word from the LORD?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:17 reveals that Zedekiah secretly asked Jeremiah if there was any word from the LORD. This shows the king's private seeking of divine guidance, even while publicly ignoring God's warnings (see also 2 Chronicles 20:12, Daniel 2:17-18, Luke 22:41-42, James 1:5).

questions.question: What was Jeremiah’s prophetic answer to King Zedekiah about his fate?
options: You will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon
You will reign peacefully many years
questions.correctAnswer: You will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:17 states Jeremiah told Zedekiah he would be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, highlighting the certainty of God's judgment despite human hope. This aligns with God's justice and sovereignty (see also 2 Kings 25:7, Ezekiel 12:13, Daniel 5:30, Revelation 19:11).

questions.question: What complaint did Jeremiah make to King Zedekiah about his imprisonment?
options: What have I done to deserve this?
I have hidden nothing from you
I am innocent of all charges
questions.correctAnswer: What have I done to deserve this?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:18 records Jeremiah asking what offense he had committed against the king, his servants, or the people to be put in prison, emphasizing the suffering of prophets for righteousness (see also 1 Peter 3:14-17, Acts 9:15-16, Hebrews 11:37, Matthew 5:10-12).

questions.question: What did Jeremiah ask King Zedekiah regarding the other prophets who gave false assurances?
options: Where are your prophets who said Babylon would not come?
Why do the prophets prophesy lies?
questions.correctAnswer: Where are your prophets who said Babylon would not come?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:19 questions the absence of prophets who falsely assured the king that Babylon would not come against them, exposing the danger of false prophecy (see also Deuteronomy 18:20-22, Jeremiah 14:14, Matthew 7:15-20, 2 Peter 2:1).

questions.question: What did Jeremiah request from King Zedekiah to avoid returning to prison where he feared death?
questions.correctAnswer: Let my supplication be accepted
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:20 shows Jeremiah pleading for his request to be accepted so he would not be returned to the house of Jonathan the scribe, where he feared death. This reveals the prophet’s vulnerability and trust in God's justice (see also Psalm 88:15-16, Isaiah 38:14, Daniel 6:10, Hebrews 4:16).

questions.question: How did King Zedekiah provide for Jeremiah’s sustenance while he was kept in the prison courtyard?
options: He gave him bread daily from the bakers' street
He sent him food from Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: He gave him bread daily from the bakers' street
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:21 states the king commanded that Jeremiah be given a piece of bread daily from the bakers' street until the bread in the city was gone, showing a measure of care despite imprisonment. This echoes God's provision for His servants under trial (see also 1 Kings 17:6, Psalm 37:25, Isaiah 41:10, Philippians 4:19).

questions.question: What theological truth is demonstrated by Jeremiah’s imprisonment despite delivering God’s true word?
options: God’s righteous servants may suffer unjustly
God always protects His prophets from harm
questions.correctAnswer: God’s righteous servants may suffer unjustly
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 37:15-16 illustrates that even faithful prophets suffer persecution for proclaiming God's truth, reflecting the biblical theme of righteous suffering (see also Psalm 34:19, Isaiah 53:3, John 15:18-21, 1 Peter 4:12-16).
